articles.title: Peak Muslim groups sign letter condemning response to Sydney nurses as 'hypocrisy'
articles.description: A number of Muslim groups have signed an open letter condemning both the comments made by two Sydney nurses about treating Israeli patients, as well as the subsequent response.
articles.content:
A group of peak Muslim groups and prominent leaders have signed an open letter condemning what they say is "hypocrisy" regarding the response to anti-Israel comments by two Sydney nurses.

articles.title: NSW Police execute search warrant on home of Sydney nurse who threatened Israeli patients
articles.description: NSW Police have executed a search warrant on the Bankstown home of one the Sydney nurses who made threats towards Israeli patients, the same day a longer video of the interaction was released.
articles.content:
NSW Police have executed a search warrant of the home of a Sydney nurse who threatened harm to Israeli patients.
According to NSW Police, officers attached to Strike Force Pearl began the search warrant of the Bankstown home at around 6pm Friday.
A n... [970 chars]

articles.title: Two nurses in Australia suspended for reportedly making antisemitic comments
articles.description: Two nurses in a Sydney hospital have been suspended from work for threatening to kill Jewish patients and refusing to treat them, triggering a police investigation, officials said.
articles.content:
SYDNEY — Two nurses in a Sydney hospital have been suspended from work for threatening to kill Jewish patients and refusing to treat them in a video on TikTok, triggering an investigation by police, authorities said Wednesday.

articles.title: Sydney nurses suspended after threatening anti-Israel video goes viral
articles.description: Police have enlisted the help of an influencer who the pair spoke to as they build a criminal case against them.
articles.content:
Two nurses caught threatening to kills Israeli patients have had their nursing credentials suspended, the national watchdog has confirmed.
Ahmad “Rashad” Nadir and Sarah Abu Lebdeh will no longer be able work in an Australian hospital after vision of... [2335 chars]

articles.title: 'No evidence' NSW Health patients adversely affected by nurses who threatened Israeli patients, police investigation awaits 'critical' evidence
articles.description: The NSW health minister says there is "no evidence" patients have been adversely affected after being treated by two Sydney nurses who spoke about threatening harm to Israeli patients, as police await an unedited version of their conversation with an Israeli content creator.
articles.content:
NSW health minister says there is so far "no evidence" patients have been adversely affected after being treated by two Sydney nurses who spoke about threatening harm to Israeli patients.

articles.title: Israeli influencer Max Veifer who posted video of NSW nurses making ‘vile’ anti-Semitic comments speaks out
articles.description: An Israeli influencer has spoken out for the first time since he exposed ‘vile’ anti-Semitic comments from two Sydney nurses made in a chance conversation online.
articles.content:
An Israeli content creator has spoken out for the first time since he exposed ‘vile’ anti-Semitic comments from two Sydney nurses made in a chance conversation online, which have left him questioning his safety in Australian hospitals.

articles.title: Sydney nurses stood down after claiming they would kill Israeli patients in social media video
articles.description: PM has condemned footage as ‘sickening’ as police and the healthcare watchdog investigate the incident

articles.title: Terrie McEvoy admits she ‘never switches off’ when it comes to balancing busy career and motherhood
articles.description: Terrie McEvoy has a lot on the go - working with student nurses, running businesses, content creation online and being a mum to her daughter Sydney - but she loves the busy lifestyle
articles.content:

articles.title: Australia's first purpose-built centre at Westmead Hospital ready for next deadly disease outbreak
articles.description: Highly trained doctors and nurses at the facility in Sydney's west will provide care to those with diseases so dangerous they're likely to kill more than half of those that contract them.
articles.content:
It's like a scene of a sci-fi film.
Emerging from a lift, lying in a sealed coffin-like bed, some of Australia's most infectious patients will be transported into a pressurised room.
